Description: Lower body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian, possibly Mature Animal Style, Grand or Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; discoloured white slip; interior glazed streaky brown (partly worn); exterior: guilloche pattern in handle zone above two lines; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The number 80 is written in pencil on the exterior surface of the sherd. Very little decoration on the interior and exterior surfaces of the sherd remain making it difficult to determine to what style the chalice belongs. The guilloche pattern appears in the Wild Goat Style and is used until the Chalice Style but the lower body of Wild Goat Style chalices is usually more heavily decorated.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 678, no. 376)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0672) (phase 2)
